speaker: Maya
text: Did you see the report that came out yesterday? It listed all the modules which failed the penetration test.
ipa: dɪd ju si ðə rɪˈpɔːt ðæt keɪm aʊt ˈjɛstədeɪ? ɪt ˈlɪstɪd ɔːl ðə ˈmɒdjuːlz wɪʧ feɪld ðə ˌpɛnɪˈtreɪʃən tɛst.

speaker: Leo
text: Yeah, especially the one that handles user sessions. That’s the same module which caused issues during last year’s release.
ipa: jæ, ɪˈspɛʃəli ðə wʌn ðæt ˈhændlz ˈjuːzə ˈsɛʃənz. ðæts ðə seɪm ˈmɒdjuːl wɪʧ kɔːzd ˈɪʃuːz ˈdjʊərɪŋ lɑːst jɪəz rɪˈliːs.

speaker: Maya
text: I talked to Sam, who wrote the original encryption layer. He thinks the vulnerability lies in a third-party library which hasn’t been updated in years.
ipa: aɪ tɔːkt tu sæm, hu rəʊt ði əˈrɪdʒənl ɪnˈkrɪpʃən ˈleɪə. hi θɪŋks ðə ˌvʌlnərəˈbɪləti laɪz ɪn ə θɜːd ˈpɑːti ˈlaɪbrəri wɪʧ ˈhæznt bɪn ʌpˈdeɪtɪd ɪn jɪəz.

speaker: Leo
text: That makes sense. Some of the APIs that we rely on still use outdated authentication headers.
ipa: ðæt meɪks sɛns. sʌm əv ði ˌeɪpiːˈaɪz ðæt wi rɪˈlaɪ ɒn stɪl juːz ˌaʊtˈdeɪtɪd ɔːˌθɛntɪˈkeɪʃən ˈhɛdəz.

speaker: Maya
text: We should contact the vendor whose software was flagged. There’s also a shared key which is hardcoded — which is definitely a red flag.
ipa: wi ʃʊd ˈkɒntækt ðə ˈvɛndə huːz ˈsɒftweə wəz flæɡd. ðɛəz ˈɔːlsəʊ ə ʃeəd kiː wɪʧ ɪz ˈhɑːdkəʊdɪd — wɪʧ ɪz ˈdɛfɪnətli ə rɛd flæɡ.

speaker: Leo
text: Agreed. And remember that script that uploads logs to the cloud? It uses a bucket to which anyone with the link has write access.
ipa: əˈɡriːd. ənd rɪˈmɛmbə ðæt skrɪpt ðæt ˈʌpləʊdz lɒɡz tu ðə klaʊd? ɪt ˈjuːzɪz ə ˈbʌkɪt tu wɪʧ ˈɛnɪwʌn wɪð ðə lɪŋk hæz raɪt ˈæksɛs.

speaker: Maya
text: You're kidding — that’s a major concern. Also, there’s a staging server which no one knew existed until last week. It was spun up by an intern who left two years ago.
ipa: jɔː ˈkɪdɪŋ — ðæts ə ˈmeɪdʒə kənˈsɜːn. ˈɔːlsəʊ, ðɛəz ə ˈsteɪdʒɪŋ ˈsɜːvə wɪʧ nəʊ wʌn njuː ɪɡˈzɪstɪd ənˈtɪl lɑːst wiːk. ɪt wəz spʌn ʌp baɪ ən ˈɪntɜːn hu lɛft tu jɪəz əˈɡəʊ.

speaker: Leo
text: This is why we need a better process. The audit checklist that we introduced last quarter should help, though.
ipa: ðɪs ɪz waɪ wi niːd ə ˈbɛtə ˈprəʊsɛs. ði ˈɔːdɪt ˈʧɛklɪst ðæt wi ˌɪntrəˈdjuːst lɑːst ˈkwɔːtə ʃʊd hɛlp, ðəʊ.

speaker: Maya
text: Definitely. And the security guidelines, which were updated just last month, already cover half of these issues.
ipa: ˈdɛfɪnətli. ənd ðə sɪˈkjʊərɪti ˈɡaɪdlaɪnz, wɪʧ wɜː ʌpˈdeɪtɪd ʤʌst lɑːst mʌnθ, ɔːlˈrɛdi ˈkʌvə hɑːf əv ðiːz ˈɪʃuːz.

speaker: Leo
text: Let’s write a follow-up doc that outlines everything we found. I’ll attach the report in which Sam detailed the patch recommendations.
ipa: lɛts raɪt ə ˈfɒləʊ ʌp dɒk ðæt ˈaʊtlaɪnz ˈɛvrɪθɪŋ wi faʊnd. aɪl əˈtæʧ ðə rɪˈpɔːt ɪn wɪʧ sæm ˈdiːteɪld ðə pæʧ ˌrɛkəˌmɛnˈdeɪʃənz.
